choices.D: Performance degradation VMs tolerate threshold is at default.

discussion.content:
Correct option must be C "There are insufficient cluster resources"

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.avail.doc/GUID-FA8B166D-A5F5-47D3-840E-68996507A95B.html
C is correct! HA can bypass the most critical and attempt to fire us lower priority VMs.

questions.question_text:
Using vSphere HA Orchestrated Restart an administrator places the most mission critical VM in the highest priority. After a host failure, the highest priority VM fails to restart while VMs in high priority restart.
What would cause this to occur?

discussion.content:
This is a good mind tease! These are the types of questions to get you thinking.
Ans is D for my exam day.
"The VM is a member of the high priority resource pool and the cluster has not experienced contention", so B is excluded; must be D

Correct: D

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-53F65726-A23B-4CF0-A7D5-48E584B88613.html

Snapshots can negatively affect the performance of a virtual machine. Performance degradation is based on how long the snapshot or snapshot tree is in place, the depth of the tree, and how much the virtual machine and its guest operating system have changed from the time you took the snapshot. Also, you might see a delay in the amount of time it takes the virtual machine to power on. Do not run production virtual machines from snapshots on a permanent basis.

questions.question_text:
A vSphere Administrator is receiving complaints a database VM is experiencing performance issues. The VM is a member of the high priority resource pool and the cluster has not experienced contention.
Which condition should be checked to address immediate performance concerns?

discussion.content: In the Questions it should be third-party instead of third-many, please rectify the question. Answer is Correct.

questions.question_text: Which vSphere Update Manager baseline type is used for scanning and remediating objects third-many device drivers?
Which two actions should an administrator take to ensure a VM has the highest networking bandwidth?

discussion.content: B & D are correct (LACP Advantages - Single VM can, in theory, handle higher traffic then single physical NIC because of load-balancing algorithm) Note: Question refers to a single VM.

After some thought, I agree on "C & D"; LACP could in theory provide higher bandwidth but it isn't guaranteed; The answer "D" should really be "Configure Network Resource Pools"; So using both dVS network resource pools along with configured shares/reservations/limits will guarantee a VM highest networking bandwidth.
https://www.vcdx200.com/2017/12/vsphere-switch-independent-teaming-or.html
